lines.text: Say, where was you hidin' last night?
Don't say a word, I was written a speech.
A what?
Yeah! The Laundrymen's Fraternal Association is giving a banquet Saturday night. The old man is gonna make a speech.
What old man?
Mine! I'm learned it to him.
When your old man croaks, Nick, you ought to get a nice piece of change along with the business.
Oh, I ain't the guy to wait for that. If I can get the backing, I'm going into the game myself. Why, over on Long Island, the wet wash territory ain't even been scratched.
Mmmm, that sure listens good to me, angel face!
Ahhh, baby!
[Hugs Peg, kisses her neck, and bite's her ear]
Hey! My ear!
You better get in training, Peg.
Nothin' high brow goes with us, hey, baby?
No.
Hello there, kiddo!
Hello, Chris.
Wait a minute!
Oh, I haven't time.
Come on inside.
Oh, Chris, please! I'll be late for work!
Ah, come on! Give me a little kiss. What's the matter? Don't you love me anymore?
Oh, don't be silly!
Ah, come on, just one.
Oh, Chris, please, you'll mess my collar. I can't be mauled!
Oh, I'm crazy about you, Laura, I can't help it.
That's good. Very good.
[Looking at an advertising layout]
Who's the model?
She's a new one.
One of your finds?
Yes. Got her right out of a department store.
Is she like this?
Oh, they don't get her beauty by 50 per cent and her personality is Park Avenue Plus!
Not a lady?
Oh, no, she's right out of the tenements. But, she has a natural gift for class!
What's her name?
Murdoch.
Sounds Irish. That's interesting.
Well, honey, this week is my farewell appearance. I've got a grand break.
Oh, what is it?
What is it? Its a nice sugar daddy and he thinks I'm the prized bathing beauty. Ha-ha-ha.
Oh, what's he like?
Well, he's not much to look at, but, oh boy, he's a wonder at writing checks!
Come in please.
Mr. Brockton would like to see Miss Murdock in the office, right away.
Oh my goodness, what am I going to do? I'm not dressed!
Well, wear a smile and go as you are! I did it once and got a raise.
With your figure, you're wasting time here. This is what you should be doing.
[Hands her his card]
Advertising Agency? What could I do there?
Model.
One of those artist's models? My mother'd pass out.
Oh-oh, no. Commercial art.
By the way, I forgot to mention, could you spare, eh, five?
Here's ten, Dad. And don't spend it all on the bootlegger.
I ain't stuck on havin' you drive up here in your fine cars and limousines. We ain't limousine people.
You know, I may be gone two, maybe, three months. What are you going to do? Are you going to be alright?
Mmm-hmm. I'll go back to my old job, commercial posing.
Not one of these artists that, eh...
No. Nothing worst than undies, darling.
You've tasted luxury, my dear. And that's worst than drugs.
I don't blame anyone, for anything.
